Awesome to see people reading BREACH after I left it on trains. Filled w/ the stories of refugees. A must read in t… https://t.co/p1FQHNusKO
Watch out Sydneysiders - copies of BREACH are on your trains this morning courtesy of @PeirenePress! A must read right now. @booksontherail
@AllenAndUnwin @HachetteAus We need to step up our game...who volunteers to bring their dogs into the office? I will if you do.
@maybethatanna @neilhimself @HachetteAus And that is why I always carry a notebook in my bag.
Want to see what I read this year for the 50 Book Challenge 2017? Check out my ongoing list here: https://t.co/xHvHkG0qza
Do yourself a favour and get your hands on a copy ASAP. You won't regret it.
ICYWW, I am never going to stop going on about @britrbennett's THE MOTHERS. It's easily in my top 5 books ever & I have read a lot of books.
Finishing the last bit of @britrbennett's THE MOTHERS with a delicious but wrongly named Starbucks Frappucino. https://t.co/7w68cunVjm
Honestly THE MOTHERS is one of my all time faves and I haven't even finished it yet. I am so grateful for @britrbennett's brilliant prose.
Ever been so in love w/ a book that you want to read all the author's books but they haven't got any others? Me w/ @britrbennett right now.
I promise that some good stuff is coming soon. I have plans...
Sorry if that means I won't be putting anything up on INWORDSANDINK for a little while. But sometimes I need a break, just for a moment.
Art is one of the best ways to get through periods of intense emotion, whatever the emotion. I'll be taking some time to ply myself w/ art.
I've been hit by a sudden sadness today. Waiting for it to pass w/ music from @doddleoddle & @rustyclanton & @britrbennett's THE MOTHERS.
History has seen this happen before, so we know what comes next. We need to stop it before it happens again. Please, stop him.
Hearing this list read aloud is one of the scariest things I have ever heard. I feel sick knowing this is happening. https://t.co/bDDnVN8IKT
I am sorry to see that world handed to Trump, but I hope we can reclaim it & fight for what the Obamas fought to teach us - kindness & love.
I am so lucky to have grown up in that world & now I will stand & speak out knowing that there is so much worth fighting for, esp in Aus.
I got to grow up looking up to such a powerful & incredible woman in @MichelleObama & see @BarackObama lead w/ integrity, honesty & respect.
I am so grateful I got to grow up w/ such inspiring leaders to look up to, because now I know that I have important things to stand up for.
...& now I watch w/ fear as the all the work that went towards making the US a more inclusive place is undone by a cruel & dangerous man.
...by a man who incites hatred with each word that comes from his mouth. Those 8 years of feeling so grateful for the President has ended...
It has just hit me all over again that all the immense progress and work done by @BarackObama & his administration is all being undone...
@tartecosmetics Do you guys offer samples? By the looks of it you have some great pale skin options, but I'd like to try them out first.
@KATVONDbeauty @HourglassMakeup @tartecosmetics @Illamasqua I will give you all the twitter love if you can help me find A+ pale foundation!
Any cruelty free brands that have an 10/10 foundation for pale skin, please help a girl out! @KATVONDbeauty @HourglassMakeup @tartecosmetics
Trying to find cruelty free foundation for my ghostly pale skin that will also stand up to the Australian heat is harder than it should be.
Reading DIFFICULT WOMEN only makes me want to shout my feminism even louder from the rooftops. @rgay's work is brilliantly awe-inspiring.
How I am dealing with the Sydney heat/miserable state of US politics: reading @rgay's DIFFICULT WOMEN @HachetteAus https://t.co/LSfkAXHwVE
This makes me so endlessly proud. https://t.co/OoKrZvlCvh
Searching for feminist pins on Etsy this morning and came across this. Immediately thought of you @papertimelady! https://t.co/SJacba8aHy
Waking up to find my twitter feed flooded by the #WomensMarch is one of the most empowering things I have ever seen. I love all of you.
I am so late to the @ilovelucius train but I don't care. I'll be here listening to "Almost Makes Me Wish For Rain"… https://t.co/Td4gHNp7nS
But in saying that, don't be tempted to feed into online hate either. Stand for change instead. I look forward to standing with you.
So while I respect your silence, I also urge you to fight to be heard above the noise of Trump's inauguration and following presidency.
It isn't easy to see Trump lead, but we need to be vocal despite him and fight to find ways for all of us to be heard in the Trump era.
I understand why people are taking social media hiatuses for the inauguration but I fear our silence will only make Trump supporters louder.
Why I Am Not Entirely Okay With @PassengersMovie (Or, A Commentary On A Good But Problematic Film): https://t.co/y4MB9QuFG2
I am crying with laughter at how fantastic the @Netflix #ASeriesOfUnfortunateEvents episodes are. It is just brilliant!
@hankgreen Outtakes include this glorious picture of Tess and one of Millie as a puppy trying to nom me when we fir… https://t.co/ZBiX9sRl5x
@hankgreen Here are some of my favourite photos of my two dogs Tess and Millie. I absolutely adore them. https://t.co/nxbgqjRhXq
I have a fan in my room so now I have all the dogs in my bed. Not complaining. https://t.co/MJoFTLzKLl
I also saw #Passengers today. All I could think about was how different the movie would be if that gardener's pod had broken down instead...
Also, the @LaLaLand soundtrack is gorgeous. I grew up on musical films like this & it does them all such justice. I… https://t.co/TsNHNyXgJx
@LaLaLand is the best film I have seen in a long time. I want to dive into its exquisite beauty & bathe in its beautiful colour and light.
A Siren Call To Remember - My Review of Christine Dibley's 'To The Sea': https://t.co/Faq3mHOvyi @MacmillanAus
"'To The Sea' is one of the first Australian novels set in Australia that I've truly felt at home in." https://t.co/Faq3mHOvyi @MacmillanAus
Just finished #OneDayAtATime and I have had tears in my eyes the whole way through. It has really left its mark on me. Watch it now.
Sometimes being an adult means doing 5 loads of laundry for the family at 1am to procrastinate things you should be doing - like sleeping.
I might write a piece on it later...I have a lot of thoughts about it.
I'm currently watching #OneDayAtATime & loving its unapologetic celebration of Latina women, its feminism & its approach to mental health. 👏
Everyone, take some time out to watch Blackfish today, & let's keep fighting for Orcas to live the life they deserve - in the wild.
#Tilikum never got to live the life he deserved but other Orcas should be able to live free. Empty the goddamn tanks @SeaWorld. For Tilikum.
Orcas live long happy lives in the wild. @SeaWorld needs to recognise that their Orcas live short and depressive lives that cause psychosis.
#Tilikum was captured & imprisoned in small tanks his whole life. He deserved better than that. Shame it cost his life for people to notice.
Wish the media would stop referring to #Tilikum as a killer in reports of his death. He was tortured and mistreated. @SeaWorld is to blame.
SURPRISE PROOF ALERT! Just received this gorgeous proof copy of A Letter From Italy in the post from @HachetteAus! https://t.co/qMfOYIBg2O
I also applaud @aladdininaus for its diverse casting & making Jasmine's feminism and value for equality more prominent than in the film.
Just saw ABLADDIN - oops I mean ALADDIN the Musical. I might have been a bit distracted by the costuming, or lack thereof... @aladdininaus
@T2SydneyTrains Someone should give Michelle the train guard a pay rise. Best train guard announcements/jokes/well wishes I've ever had!
Anyone else have the problem where you get so excited about the books coming out this year that you can't focus on the one you're reading?

@juliekoh Happy New Year to you too Julie!
@NorthoverScott @JohnBirmingham No I haven't, but I always love a good book recommendation!

I read 52 books in 2016, about one a week. Here's a list of my favourite books from those 52. My Top Books of 2016: https://t.co/615rLUUqP3
Watching her in Singin' In The Rain as a child was only the start of my admiration for her, an admiration that grew as I did. Vale.
Debbie Reynolds was a star, a true brightly shining star. I send my love to her & Carrie's family. She will be as missed as she was loved.
2016, brought to you by the Dark Side.
Also, really 2016? Can you please just stop now? Between all the war, death, political turmoil, and Trump, we are done.
She was more than Leia. She spoke out about mental health, was wickedly funny & shone brightly. She deserved more time. RIP Carrie Fisher.
NO. Not Carrie Fisher. Please not Carrie Fisher.
George Michael's music was such an essential part of how I came to love music & all it stood for. I grew up on it. He will be missed.
Just when I thought 2016 couldn't be more of a heartless bitch, she took George Michael from us. Such an icon & wonderful artist. RIP.
Just received a surprise delivery of two books for review from @HachetteAus! Merry Christmas to me! Thanks @HachetteAus!
